title: Rusyn language
summary: The Rusyn language (/ˈruːsɪn/;[13] Carpathian Rusyn: русиньскый язык (rusîn'skyj jazyk), Pannonian Rusyn: руски язик (ruski jazik)),[14] also known as the Rusnak language (Carpathian Rusyn: руснацькый язык / an older term),[15][16] is an East Slavic lect, spoken by Rusyns in several regions of Eastern Europe, as well as by the Rusyn diaspora in other parts of the world.[17][18]
